sense.name: Cause to arise, make a new situation occur, perhaps in a rapid manner.
sense.examples: The news induced a crisis worldwide. Cardiac pacemakers stimulate the heart to induce a heartbeat. The infection induced a high fever and allergic reactions almost immediately. Doctors use medicine to induce labor.

sense.name: Cause to do; cause to act in a certain manner.
sense.commentary: Note: Compare to Sense 1: verb causes and action, not the creation of a situation.
sense.examples: The ads induced me to buy a VCR. The campaign induced senators to oppose the bill.

sense.name: Reason or establish by induction.
sense.examples: They induce mathematically convenient and efficient sparse matrix constructs.

sense.name: Produce electric current by electrostatic or magnetic properties.
sense.examples: This means that an electrical current will be induced in any closed circuit when the magnetic flux through a surface bounded by the conductor changes.
